```{r}
new_cm <- readRDS("/data/gpfs/projects/punim2183/samples_processing/new_cm.rds")
# 1. Create the Seurat object from your count matrix
new_seurat <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = new_cm$cm)

# 2. Process
new_seurat <- NormalizeData(new_seurat, layer = "counts")
new_seurat <- FindVariableFeatures(new_seurat)
new_seurat <- ScaleData(new_seurat, layer = "data")

# 3. Verify
print(Layers(new_seurat))  # Should show: "counts" "data" "scale.data"

# Add mitochondrial percentage (adjust gene pattern if needed)
new_seurat[["percent.mt"]] <- PercentageFeatureSet(new_seurat, pattern = "^MT-")

# Visualize QC metrics
VlnPlot(new_seurat, features = c("nCount_RNA", "nFeature_RNA", "percent.mt"))

# Filter cells (adjust thresholds based on your data)
new_seurat <- subset(new_seurat, 
                    subset = nFeature_RNA > 200 & 
                            nFeature_RNA < 6000 &
                            percent.mt < 20)

# Run PCA (using variable features)
new_seurat <- RunPCA(new_seurat)

# Visualize PCA results
DimPlot(new_seurat, reduction = "pca")
ElbowPlot(new_seurat) # Helps determine significant PCs

# Find markers for all clusters
all_markers <- FindAllMarkers(new_seurat,
                             only.pos = TRUE,
                             min.pct = 0.25,
                             logfc.threshold = 0.25)

# Top markers per cluster
top_markers <- all_markers %>%
  group_by(cluster) %>%
  slice_max(n = 5, order_by = avg_log2FC)

# Visualize marker expression
FeaturePlot(new_seurat, features = top_markers$gene[1:4])

FeaturePlot(new_seurat, features = c("Ntrk2FL", "Ntrk2trunc"))

```
